elements.content: IRRaman spectraPXRDcrystallographic data‡ Synthesis of 1: a mixture of Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (0.30 g, 1.0 mmol), H3PIMDC (0.10 g, 0.5 mmol) and 8 mL water was heated in a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave at 180 °C for 5 days under static pressure, and then cooled to room temperature. The light yellow hexagonal prism crystals were obtained, washed with water and air-dried. Yield: 0.14 g (∼54% based on Zn). Anal. Calcd for C48H60N12O35Zn11 (%): C, 27.64; H, 2.88; N, 8.06. Found (%): C, 27.55; H, 2.76; N, 8.02. IR data (solid KBr pellet per cm): 3553(m), 3442(m), 3220(br), 2959(m), 2929(w), 2868(w), 1593(s), 1450(s), 1372(s), 1232(s), 1215(m), 1128(s), 934(m), 883(m), 858(m), 815(m), 733(w), 689(w), 613(w), 537(w), 414(m); Raman spectrum (cm−1): 2805(w), 1576(s), 1482(br), 1363(br).
elements.clean_text:
IR

Raman spectra

PXRD

crystallographic data

‡ Synthesis of 1: a mixture of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.30 g, 1.0 mmol), H3PIMDC (0.10 g, 0.5 mmol) and 8 mL water was heated in a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave at 180 °C for 5 days under static pressure, and then cooled to room temperature. The light yellow hexagonal prism crystals were obtained, washed with water and air-dried. Yield: 0.14 g (~54% based on Zn). Anal. Calcd for C48H60N12O35Zn11 (%): C, 27.64; H, 2.88; N, 8.06. Found (%): C, 27.55; H, 2.76; N, 8.02. IR data (solid KBr pellet per cm): 3553(m), 3442(m), 3220(br), 2959(m), 2929(w), 2868(w), 1593(s), 1450(s), 1372(s), 1232(s), 1215(m), 1128(s), 934(m), 883(m), 858(m), 815(m), 733(w), 689(w), 613(w), 537(w), 414(m); Raman spectrum (cm-1): 2805(w), 1576(s), 1482(br), 1363(br).

elements.content: waterautoclavewaterIRRaman spectrum§ Crystal data for 1: C48H60N12O35Zn11, M = 2804.15, trigonal, a = b = 14.3470(18) Å, c = 20.408(2) Å, V = 3637.9(7) Å3, T = 298(2) K, space groupPc1, Z = 2, 14004 reflections measured, 2152 independent reflections. The final R1 values were 0.0662 (I > 2σ(I)). The final wR(F2) values were 0.1703 (I > 2σ(I)). The final R1 values were 0.1019 (all data). The final wR(F2) values were 0.1920 (all data). Intensity data were measured using a Bruker Smart Apex II CCD diffractometer with graphite-monochromated Mo-Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å). All absorption corrections were performed using SADABS.19 The structure was solved by direct methods and refined on F2 by full-matrix least-squares analysis with SHELXL-97 software.20 The hydrogens on O atoms were directly located from successive Fourier differences syntheses. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically.
